MiniGamePackage

Class MiniGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • MiniGamePackage.MiniGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class MiniGame
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The Mini Game super class. To develop you own mini game you need to derive from this class and override the methods initGame(), gameHasStarted(), gameHasFinished(), getCurrentComputerScore(), getCurrentPlayerScore(), playerMove(Action), computerMove(Action), getNrofComputerGoActions(int), getNrOfPlayerGoActionsMax(int) and getName()

    MiniGame is derived from Component (via JPanel) and can be added into an AWT/Swing container (e.g., JFrame)

    To control your Mini Game (e.g., from within your JFrame subclass), you need to call the methods newGame(int difficulty), playerActionUp(), playerActionDown() and playerActionGo()

    To be notified about the game's status you need to implement the interface MiniGameObserver and call registerMiniGameObserver(MiniGameObserver)
    Version:
    1.00
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • initGame

        protected abstract void initGame()
        implement here whatever is needed to initialize your game before you can play it (again), e.g., clean up the screen
        Please note that afterwards the player has to perform the GO action to actually start the game.

      • gameHasStarted

        protected abstract void gameHasStarted()
        implement here what needs to be done when a new game has just started (potentially nothing if everything is done in initGame())

        implement here what needs to be done when a game has just finished (potentially nothing )

      • getNrofComputerGoActions

        public abstract int getNrofComputerGoActions(int difficulty)
        return the number of (random) 'GO' actions that the computer performs according to a given level of difficulty 1 to 10
        Parameters:
        difficulty - values from 1-10 representing the level of difficulty
        Returns:
        max number of the computer's 'GO' actions

      • getNrOfPlayerGoActionsMax

        public abstract int getNrOfPlayerGoActionsMax(int difficulty)
        return the (max) number of 'GO' actions that the player can perform according to a given level of difficulty 1 to 10
        Parameters:
        difficulty - values from 1-10 representing the level of difficulty
        Returns:
        number of the player's 'GO' actions

        to be called from outside when the human's player performs the 'GO' action

      • newGame

        public final void newGame(int difficulty)
        To be called from outside to let the user play a new game
        This will also call initGame(). Please note that afterwards the user has to perform the GO action to actually start the game (by which gameHasStarted() will be called).

      • getSprites

        protected final Sprite[] getSprites(int i)
        returns the MAX_NR_SPRITE_COPIES copies of a Sprite
        Parameters:
        i - which Sprite
        Returns:
        array with MAX_NR_SPRITE_COPIES copies of a Sprite

      • getSprite

        protected final Sprite getSprite(int i,
               int j)
        provides access to the Mini Game's Sprites. MAX_NR_SPRITES different Sprites are provided. For each Sprite MAX_NR_SPRITE_COPIES copies are provided. Copies all look the same, but can be displayed at different places on the screen simultaneously
        Parameters:
        i - which Sprite
        j - which copy
        Returns:
        the Sprite object

      • getBackgroundPicture

        protected final Background getBackgroundPicture()
        provides access to the background of the Mini Game's screen
        Returns:
        the Background object

      • registerMiniGameObserver

        public final void registerMiniGameObserver(MiniGameObserver mgo)
        if you want to be informed about the game's status register a MiniGameObserver. Afterwards the MiniGameOberserver's method gameStatusUpdate(...) is called to inform you about the current scores, the time left and if the game is still running
        Only one observer is allowed at a time.
        Parameters:
        mgo - an instance of a class implementing the MiniGameObserver interface

      • getTimeLeft

        public int getTimeLeft()
        Returns:
        time left in the game in msec (0..GAME_DURATION_IN_MSEC)

      • getRandomNr

        public int getRandomNr(int min,
              int max)
        creates a random number
        Returns:
        random number between min (inclusive) and max (inclusive)

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
